result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Nicholas Lee Olson

records.addlTxt:
8:45 AM Defendant Nicholas Lee Olson in court.  Attorney Bruce Patrick Anderson in court for Nicholas Lee Olson.  Attorney Benjamin James Webster in court for State of Wisconsin. NMG-clerk. Officer Vanessa Neumann S&T. State questions Officer Neumann. CT finds identification made. Cross by Atty Anderson. CT finds PC, def bound over for trial. Bond cont. 
Arraignment: Reading waived. DE plea NG, CT accepts plea. Def is preserved 15 days on pre arraignment rights. adj. 8:55 am
Pre-trial conference scheduled for December 19, 2022 at 09:15 am.
Pre-trial conference on December 19, 2022 at 09:15 am.

10:03 AM. JL-Clerk. Defendant Nicholas Lee Olson in court.  Attorney Bruce Patrick Anderson in court for Nicholas Lee Olson.  Attorney Benjamin James Webster in court for State of Wisconsin. WSPH. Bond cont. 10:05 am adj.
Preliminary hearing scheduled for September 20, 2022 at 08:45 am.
Preliminary hearing on September 20, 2022 at 08:45 am.

2:24 PM. JL-Clerk. Defendant Nicholas Lee Olson in court.  Attorney Benjamin James Webster in court for State of Wisconsin. Def is planning to hire Bruce Anderson. 2:25 pm adj.
Adjourned initial appearance scheduled for September 6, 2022 at 10:00 am.
Adjourned initial appearance on September 6, 2022 at 10:00 am.

No controlled substances without a prescription and only in amount/frequency as prescribed. Subject to testing to determine compliance upon reasonable suspicion. Not to operate a motor vehicle unless properly licensed.

1:18 PM Defendant Nicholas Lee Olson appeared by video from PCJ, in custody.  Attorney Derek Sanders in court. Attorney Benjamin James Webster appeared by video for State of Wisconsin. RL-clerk.  Does not qualify. Def indicates he is going to hire counsel. ADA requests $1500 sig bond. CT sets bond. Def is advised of options to obtain counsel. May file petition for ct appt attorney if unable to hire own counsel. Due at least a week prior to next court date. 1:21 pm adj.
Adjourned initial appearance scheduled for August 8, 2022 at 02:00 pm.
Adjourned initial appearance on August 8, 2022 at 02:00 pm.
